abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Liuzhou
            Environment Management Project for China is to assist
            Liuzhou Municipality of Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous region in
            improving the municipality's environmental conditions
            by investing in wastewater treatment facilities, industrial
            pollution control, municipal sanitation services and solid
            waste services and management. The total project costs have
            increased from US$205.6 million to US$216.13 million due to
            substantial depreciation of US dollars against RMB, as the
            exchange rate is reduced from 8.2868 at appraisal to 6.6275
            at end of 2010. The reallocation is necessary to fully fund
            the remaining ongoing works after recent price escalations
            increased contract costs. In order to ensure that the
            project management unit and project implementing units have
            sufficient time to submit final withdrawal applications
            after the Loan closing date, a four month grace period,
            through October 31, 2011, is added.
